solution_line_template: The first three groups have a total of {first_group_children} + {second_group_children} + {third_group_children} = <<{first_group_children}+{second_group_children}+{third_group_children}={first_three_groups_children}>>{first_three_groups_children} children.
All together, the camp has {first_three_groups_children} + {fourth_group_children} = <<{first_three_groups_children}+{fourth_group_children}={total_children}>>{total_children} children.
In one day, the children consume {bottles_per_child_per_day} x {total_children} = <<{bottles_per_child_per_day}*{total_children}={daily_consumption}>>{daily_consumption} bottles of water.

In {camp_duration_days} days, the children will need {daily_consumption} x {camp_duration_days} = <<{daily_consumption}*{camp_duration_days}={total_bottles_needed}>>{total_bottles_needed} bottles of water.
The camp organizer has already purchased {cases_purchased} x {bottles_per_case} = <<{cases_purchased}*{bottles_per_case}={bottles_purchased}>>{bottles_purchased} bottles of water.
The camp organizer must buy another {total_bottles_needed} - {bottles_purchased} = <<{total_bottles_needed}-{bottles_purchased}={bottles_still_needed}>>{bottles_still_needed} bottles of water.
